thread.title: NY cop denies drug trafficking charges
thread.title_full: NY cop denies drug trafficking charges - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: WCAX News
title: NY cop denies drug trafficking charges
text:
BURLINGTON, Vt. - A New York City police officer has denied charges of distributing drugs in Vermont.
Andre Clarke, 36, of the Bronx, was indicted Monday on federal charges. Prosecutors say he supplied Oxycodone to another New York man, who gave the drugs to a Burlington man to sell to area addicts.
After the court hearing Wednesday, Clarke was released on conditions. The 13-year veteran cop has been suspended from the NYPD. He faces up to 20 years if convicted.
The other two men-- Michael Foreste of New York and Dannis Hackney of Vermont-- also pleaded not guilty.
Related Story:
NY police officer accused of dealing opiates in Vermont
